newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - June BTPs to brake at 128.76 resistance.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - June BTPs to brake at 128.76 resistance.

text.p: June BTPs on LIFFE look positive after powering higher in Tuesday's early session, but are likely to come to a halt close to current session highs, technical analysts said on Tuesday.

"Resistance is to be found at the daily downtrend 128.76, which is expected to hold for the next few days," wrote Brenda Sullivan and Elizabeth Miller of Deutsche Morgan Grenfell in a note to clients.
The June contract was trading 59 basis points above Friday's close at 0802 GMT, at 128.42. The contract earlier reached a high of 128.65.

The contract broke through resistance at Thursday and Friday's highs of 128.40 after Italian March EU-harmonised consumer price inflation rose 2.2 percent year-on-year, fanning expectations of a cut in interest rates. Monday was a market holiday in London.
Support for the contract lies at 127.75 and more substantial support at 127.50, said Elli Gifford, independent technical analyst near Cambridge.
"There will be some easing later on today, but support may not be tested," she said.
June Eurolira futures were two basis points higher at 93.25 at 0840 GMT.
"There is potential for an extension higher toward retracement at 93.38, but unlikely through the downtrend at 93.47," said Sullivan and Miller.
